action.action-desc: Mr. Stewart (for himself and Ms. Bonamici) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To amend the Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 to prohibit the imposition of a nondisclosure agreement as a condition of the payment of any award or settlement in connection with a violation of such Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Victims' Voice and Transparency Act.

section.header: Prohibiting imposition of nondisclosure agreement as condition of award or settlement under Congressional Accountability Act of 1995

subsection.text: Section 401 of the Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 (2 U.S.C. 1401) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Except as otherwise provided and inserting (a) Procedures available.—Except as otherwise provided; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: A nondisclosure agreement may not be imposed on any party as a condition of the payment of any award or settlement in connection with a violation of part A of title II.

The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to awards and settlements paid in connection with the Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
